job.title: Enterprise Sales Manager - APAC
job.description:
As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day,, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.

The company has offices in London, UK, New York City, Singapore and Tokyo. We are backed by Evolution Equity Partners, SoftBank, SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group.

To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.

Are you a passionate and enthusiastic Enterprise Sales Manager with a wealth of experience selling SaaS solutions to enterprise companies? Are you looking for your next challenge in an emerging and exciting market? If yes then we want to hear from you!

The impact you will have:

You will join our global Commercial team, and champion uncovering and developing new customer relationships across the APAC region. As an Enterprise Sales Manager you will become an expert in Elliptic’s value proposition, helping our prospective customers navigate and enter the cryptocurrency market with your knowledge and understanding of our product and compliance and regulatory environments.

You will manage the full sales cycle including prospecting, qualifying leads, negotiating terms, developing custom proposals and closing business to ultimately deliver profitable revenue growth and exceed your targets.

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced individual looking for a role where you can make an impact not just on the company you work for but also on the market you work in. Fascinating and challenging work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!

What you’ll do:

  • Develop net new business and cross sell opportunities
  • Build out strategic market penetration plan, prospect, and manage full sales cycle
  • Prospect and generate high quality leads
  • Develop custom proposals based on customer requirements
  • Conduct presentations and product demos
  • Negotiate terms and close the business
  • As applicable, work alongside our Customer Engagement team to develop deeper relationships and upsell to set and hit aggressive revenue goals
  • Meet and exceed quarterly and annual quota

You will be a great fit here if you:

  • Can understand the customer’s business model, and how digital assets fit into their strategy
  • Have the ability to analyse data to identify market trends and opportunities for cryptocurrency and compliance
  • Can evaluate customer needs and preferences in relation to pricing, product terms and conditions to ensure that client requirements are addressed in commercial proposals
  • Have a collaborative mindset
  • Address problems immediately and can work across functions to solve problems
  • Enjoy working with pace and energy, building team spirit and cultivating unity and commitment among the team
  • Have an understanding of complex B2B sales methodologies
  • Are flexible, adaptable and comfortable with changing priorities

Our ideal candidate has:

  • 5+ years full sales cycle experience selling Enterprise SaaS solutions
  • Strong outbound prospecting skills, with track record of generating net new business
  • Demonstrated track record of success and quota over achievement - top 10% performer at your last company
  • A strong work ethic and an entrepreneur’s mindset. You’re comfortable creating value in a low structure environment while being agile and resilient
  • Interest and curiosity about digital assets and the crypto economy

Bonus Points for:

  • Intimate understanding of AML/KYC and Forensics space, either in cryptocurrency or traditional financial environments
  • Experience selling SaaS solutions to Financial Services
  • Borderline obsession with emerging technology
  • Share Options
  • Holiday - 24 days of annual leave in addition to Singapore gazetted holidays
  • Health insurance
  • Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite
  • Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription
  • Laptop + equipment you need
  • Home office allowance
  • Full access to Spill Mental Health Support

We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade, Kraken has risen to become one of the largest, most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet. 

We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank, providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter. 

Our diverse group of 2,400+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture, united by a shared passion for delighting customers, upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve, are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential. 

Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and we’re just getting started. We’re growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution!

About the Role
The Strategic Finance Analyst role will support all of Kraken’s strategic finance needs including modeling business scenarios, tracking performance metrics, and working with leaders to make strategic company decisions. You are an ambitious individual who is excited by the challenge of solving tough, often ambiguous problems in this dynamic space. You are able to make well-informed recommendations based on data and analysis. You can communicate your findings and recommendations verbally and in concise and actionable reports. Intellectual curiosity and a desire to learn everything cryptocurrency are a requirement for this role. The data focused analyst role will dedicate more time in gathering and driving insights through large datasets and work on automation projects to improve efficiency of our team and our company.

Who you are:
  • Strong academic background in Finance or a quantitative field (mathematics, economics, physics, engineering, etc) preferred.
  • At least 1 years of work experience in finance, tech, or related fields.
  • Extensive experience working with large datasets using Excel (advanced formulas and VBA macros) and reading/writing SQL queries.
  • Proficiency in programming (especially Python or C++) an advantage.
  • Strong understanding of accounting, financial, and valuation 
  • Attention to detail with a drive to solve problems, investigate issues, and creative thinking.
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment.
  • Ability to navigate ambiguous situations and deliver results.
  • Intrinsic motivation with a strong desire to make a positive impact on the organization.

    • What you'll do:
  • Leverage extremely large databases maintained by the Data teams to create advanced reports & data visualizations to communicate Kraken’s performance and advise ongoing projects.
  • Assist team members in sourcing/scripting additional datasets and conducting detailed quantitative analysis to drive deep insights and generate impact. 
  • Develop and maintain automation models to improve proficiency and accuracy of internal processes.
  • Perform financial and operational deep dives across products, regions, business lines to understand ROI, margins, opportunity cost, and valuation impact.
  • Assist the Strategic Finance team in preparing presentations and other updates for our executives, the board, and investors.
  • Effectively build financial models to both understand the quantitative and qualitative aspects of what’s happening, and communicate findings &  recommendations to the team.

job.title: Front-end / Data Visualisation Developer (100% remote, part-time).
job.description:
About us

MakerDAO is an unbiased global financial system. A Decentralised Autonomous Organization (DAO) that manages an Ethereum-based protocol that issues the Dai stablecoin and facilitates collateral-backed loans.


We are the Data Insights core unit. We provide free and permissionless datasets to the entire community. Our goal is to enable every user to access and interact with on-chain and off-chain data related to the MakerDAO protocol. We are currently a 3 person team, a product manager and data engineers, based in different countries in Europe 🇪🇺 .

You can read more about our core unit in our MIP mandate post.


What we need


We are looking for a frontend developer to create a platform(s) to visualise our data.

We are a small team mainly focused on data engineering, so the ideal candidate is looking for independence and wants own the end-to-end frontend, including design, implementation and improvement.

We want to further improve the value we deliver the community by creating the best possible user experience. While we already provide datasets to some of the core systems of MakerDAO, we want to expand our each by creating rich visualisations for users of all skills to interact with them.

We are technology agnostic with a preference for popular frameworks. The backend team works with:

  • Github (version control)
  • AWS (hosting)
  • Snowflake (structured database)
  • Python (data pipeline, analysis)
  • FastApi (public api)
  • gSheet (input/output)

While also making use of any interesting set of tools, such as Flask, Tableau Public and Streamlit, among others.


You can take a look at our roadmap to get a better idea of what we are planning to do.

You will

  • Work with the PM and data engineers to build the user-facing web applications
  • Designing the feel and look of UIs
  • Deciding the best way to showcase data
  • Implementing the designs into fully workable products


Current assets

The Data Insights website (Notion, Cloudflare)



Previously created GUIs to support our datasets:

MCD Voting Tracker (Flask)

MCD Vault Tracker (Flask)

Governance Voting Overview (Tableau Public)


The community of MakerDAO is diverse and has produced some wonderful GUIs that we look up to:

  • Risk Dashboard - created by the Risk CU
  • makerburn - created by the community member @makerburn
  • daistats - created by @nanexcool, maintained by @tbone


Requirements:

Required

  • Solid experience in the design, development and implementation of data web-apps, including visualizations.
  • Expertise in user experience, usability and visual communication.
  • Comfortable working in a remote team.

Optional

  • Experience in crypto/web3/DeFi/TradFi
  • React
  • Typescript
  • D3.js

Not required

  • Backend
  • User data input
  • User management

job.description:
Republic is a financial technology firm that allows everyone to invest in private markets. Republic operates several distinct business lines including a retail investment platform, a private capital division, and a blockchain advisory practice. The Republic ecosystem has deployed over $800 million in investments, has supported over 800 companies, and is comprised of a community of over 1.5M users across 100 countries. Republic is backed by dozens of leading investment firms and financial institutions and its affiliated entities have co-invested with the best names in venture and private equity. Founded in 2016, Republic is headquartered in New York City with offices worldwide. 

The Associate Counsel for Republic's Deal Room will advise and support all aspects of our venture capital investment fund formation and direct investment in support of the firm’s specialized syndicated funds and investment advisory businesses.

We are looking for an Associate Counsel with a strong working knowledge and experience of private capital markets including fund formation, private offering exemptions, limited partnerships, Investment Advisers Act and Investment Company Act, tax and ERA compliance matters will be critical for success. This position will report to Republic’s Legal Department and the Managing Director of the Republic Deal Room, providing legal services for the benefit of Republic’s Private Deal Room division as well as Republic Retail related legal matters.  

What you'll do:
  • Draft, review and negotiate private fund limited partnership agreements and amendments; investment management / advisory agreements; private placement memoranda; subscription documents; side letters; placement agent agreements; and administration agreements
  • Familiarity with syndicates and managed accounts.
  • Ensure compliance with all applicable securities and tax laws and regulations, regarding specialized fund offerings.
  • Understanding tax sensitivities of various investor classes is a plus.
  • Collaboratively coordinate with internal key stakeholders across the firm.
  • Oversee fund’s investment and closings.
  • Handle and coordinate US regulatory filings and applications.
  • Manage efficiently the use and costs of fund formation and finance outside counsel.
  • Other projects and tasks as they arise from time to time.

    • What we're looking for
  • Juris Doctorate from an accredited U.S. law school and licensed to practice in at least one state
  • 4+ years of experience at a reputable law firm or investment fund with significant private equity fund formation and private investments, with strong familiarity of capital markets and securities law.
  • Exhibits sound practical judgment with a client-service and commercial orientation
  • Strong interpersonal skills and a positive work ethic and able to be flexible to deliver under higher pressure and tight deadlines
  • Proven analytical and organizational skills with the ability to handle projects from inception to conclusion; subject matter expert with quality decision-making; and, fostering a collaborative team environment
  • Communicate complex ideas in an understandable manner with all levels of Republic’s operations.

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade, Kraken has risen to become one of the largest, most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet.

You are always curious, seeking to solve problems and finding new ways to connect people around stories. job.title: Head of Customer Success - PayDay
job.description:
ABOUT THE TEAM
Since 2015, Revolut has introduced over 20 million customers to a new way to handle their money.
We approach sales at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex issues, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. From on-boarding flows to sales processes, our goal is to both inform and delight. 
Put simply, we build things we want to use ourselves, that we’re proud to show to our friends and families.

ABOUT THE ROLE
Your mission is to build and lead a world class Customer Success team from scratch, relentlessly focusing on providing the fastest and most streamlined onboarding experience for clients and partners, driving exponential growth in product usage in your client book, and driving a high-performance culture in your team. 

Revolut is the UK’s most valuable ever private tech company, and we achieved this by continually questioning the status quo when it comes to finance. With On-Demand Pay, we’re challenging the way that salaries are paid, and putting our users in control of when they receive their wages. 

More than half of all employees experience cash flow issues every 2-4 months or more, and financial stress is the number one reason they are likely to leave their job. As Head of Customer Success, you will help companies globally solve this problem by helping them implement Revolut On-Demand Pay and promote employee financial wellbeing with the usage of Revolut’s full suite of financial products. 

You will be at the forefront of our mission to Revolutionise financial well-being, democratising cash-flow cadence and inspiring thought leadership at the world’s most influential corporations.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:
• Manage a team of customer success managers and manage hiring for the customer success team
• Oversee the onboarding process of customers and partners, including project management for GTM and technical integration. Ensure that all the customer and internal stakeholders are aware of what is expected from them and when
• Manage strategic and key accounts and partners with Payday
• Engaging employers and persuading them to market Payday to their employees
• Implement a system to document and communicate product feedback to relevant teams including Product, Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Operations
• Build and maintain internal and external knowledge base for customers and internal teams to reference including self-service instructions
• Implement a process to prioritise and manage customer requests

WHAT SKILLS YOU’LL NEED
• 3+ years experience in customer success / excellence; ideally in top tech companies
• Experience of hiring and building a customer success team
• Experience of developing trusted relationships with new clients

NICE TO HAVE
• Expertise in project managing launch and GTM plans with clients
• Expertise in launching employee outreach campaigns and educating employees in benefits or wellbeing
• STEM background
• Past experience in Tier-1 or tier-2 strategy consultancies or investment banks

Please note - you have to be based in one of the following countries: UK, Ireland, Spain, Portugal, France, Germany, Lithuania, Poland, Romania
#remote


A little about us…When Revolut was founded in 2015, we had a vision to build a sustainable, digital alternative to traditional big banks. Our mission now is to help our customers improve their financial health, empower them to have more control, and promote financial cohesion across the communities in which we operate. Launching into 2021 with 15 million Personal customers and over half a million Business customers only reinforced our belief in the vast need across the world for better financial services.


What we’re looking for…Revolut is being scaled up by people all around the world who share our vision. We’re looking for people who align with our five core values: we believe that we Get it Done because we Think Deeper and are strongly rooted in the Dream Team. We Never Settle hence why we always Deliver Wow. You want to join a community of forward-thinking people - we are here for you. We believe in empowering our Revoluters in their work, giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do. We want everyone at Revolut to own their story and their successes - working with us means you’re not just another cog in the machine.

THE BENEFITS
